data.title: Lidgren - MacOS issues
data.body: MonoGame on MAC throws a notimplementedexception on IPv4Mask, so we return null on Mac Implementation. Had to add a MONOMAC define to the project as well.

data.title: Code cleanup
Content Pipleine Xamarin Studio Addin
data.body:
This PR includes

1) An Addin for Windows and Mac for Xamarin Studio to compile the following content
  a) Textures  - DXT and PVRTC compression support
  b) SpriteFonts - Can use system fonts like XNA does, BUT you can also put the font file in the same directory as the .spritefont and it will pick that file up. 

It also has some changes to support Audio processing on Mac and a fix for NAudio on Windows when producing .mp4 files. The Audio processing seems to be working ok on Mac and can convert a .wav to an .mp4, and a .wav to an .xnb which can then be used. 

This has been tested on Mac and Windows.

data.title: Removed PreferredInterfaceOrientationForPresentation() for iOS
data.body:
Overriding this method is not something that is commonly required on iOS.

It also causes the following bug:
- Create a MonoGame game that runs in `LandscapeLeft` or `LandscapeRight`
- Play the game in `LandscapeLeft`
- Pull out the underlying `UIViewController` and present a native iOS controller via `PresentViewController`
- Dimiss the modal controller
- The MonoGame controller will return `LandscapeRight` for `PreferredInterfaceOrientationForPresentation()`
- Your game will be upside down.

Removing the method completely fixes the issue in our game.

I have not tested it, but I presume the same would happen with a portrait game when it is oriented `PortraitUpsideDown`.

Does anyone know if this method was overridden for a specific purpose? It is not commonly used in standard iOS apps. Apple doc here (might need to scroll down): http://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/UIKit/Reference/UIViewController_Class/Reference/Reference.html#//apple_ref/occ/instm/UIViewController/preferredInterfaceOrientationForPresentation

data.title: Fix XACT IsPlaying properties.
data.body:
Currently, XactClip and XactSound assume that `IsPlaying` is only true when SoundState == Playing. However, the wave is technically playing when it is either Playing or Paused, since pausing is still in the middle of playback (as opposied to stopping, which resets the playback position).

So, the expected behavior should be:

`SoundState.Stopped`: `Playing == false`, `IsPaused == false`
`SoundState.Playing`: `Playing == true`, `IsPaused == false`
`SoundState.Paused`: `Playing == true`, `IsPaused == true`

And there should never be a case where `Playing == false` and `IsPaused == true`.

data.title: FR: can Liggren network code be split into a separate lib for next release?
data.body:
I know there has been a call to break up the MonoGame base into several libs which will take a fair amount of time and effort.

But as a first stab can the networking code be split into a MonoGame.Net lib (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Net) so that Ligren is not needed for every project regardless of the requirement for networking.

This will also simplify the creation of samples that don't use networking

data.title: MGFX compiler does not like sampler states as parameters
OSX sound related changes
data.body:
We added the OSX platform to MGSongProcessor to allow the songs to be MP3 compressed, they play fine on Monogame MacOS.

We also fixed a call SoundEffect constructor, looks like a constructor receiving a path to a file is no longer available so we just created the stream before creating the effect.

data.title: Shader built with wrong MGFX version???
Added OSX platform to MGSongProcessor.cs to compress mp3 songs
data.body: On the current develop branch, we weren't able to play music on OSX. By adding OSX to MGSongProcessor and letting it compile to mp3, it worked decently.

data.title: Cannot load content built for other platforms
data.body:
Thanks to my fix in #1925 content built for the non standard platforms correctly has a different platform identifier in it.
This causes content loading to fail as we test for the XNA ones.

To fix this we need to either move the array of allowed characters somewhere that can be shared between the content pipeline project and runtime project, or remove the runtime check.

Heres the place that needs fixing, I've just copy pasted in the array:
https://github.com/danzel/MonoGame/commit/1c52d9e1f5647767bced8d285d9b855f3590d777

Thoughts on where to put it? Will need to be public static (Or we could set up internals sharing if that is widely supported) so both projects can use it.

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.runtime.compilerservices.internalsvisibletoattribute.aspx

data.title: Visual Studio 2012 "Windows OpenGL" Template doesn't work.
data.body:
I just installed MonoGame 3.01 for the first time and created a brand new project from scratch using the "MonoGame Windows OpenGL Project" template for C# in Visual Studio 2012 (Update 3).  

I tried to run without debugging, the screen flashes, and then nothing (reproducable every time).  Ran with debugging, an exception was thrown on Game1 class construction (the yellow line highlights lines 22, and 23: "public Game1(): base()" ).

The error message is titled "DllNotFoundException was unhandled." 
And the details read: "Unable to load DLL 'openal32.dll': The specified module could not be found. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x8007007E)"

I'm running Windows 7 x64, and Visual Studio 2012 (Update 3) with all the latest updates installed.

data.title: Pass the current Platform/Profile down when building content.
data.body:
This allows content writers to save things different for different platforms.

I'm using this to work aroun WP8 not supporting Texture2D.FromStream in my own project where I save a PNG for all  platforms that support it, or raw PARGB32 on WP8.

data.title: PremultiplyAlpha should be set true by default
data.body:
DefaultValueAttribute does not set the value, just hints it.
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1980520/defaultvalue-attribute-is-not-working-with-my-auto-property

This change means when building texture content with mgcb it will be premultiplied by default, matching the XNA default.

data.title: Fixed Texture2D.GetData with a specified source rectangle.
Ghost touches on windows phone 8
data.body: I'm making a (very awesome) drawing app for windows phone, but I noticed that if I touch the screen with 3+ fingers, the TouchPanel.GetState() returns more and more touches. As if some ghost touches start to appear. There can be as many as 20+ ghost touches at a time.

data.title: issue #1920: Song always loops on Android
data.body:
This is a pretty simple fix for issue #1920: Song always loops on Android
Sets the looping value to the correct value

data.title: Song always loops on Android
data.body:
The Song class always loops when played on Android.
It is hard coded to set Android.Media.MediaPlayer.Looping = true;

Expected:
The endpoint for whether or not a song is looped is MediaPlayer.IsRepeating
The Song class should be checking that when it sets the Looping value.

data.title: BlendFunction Min and Max does not work
data.body:
BlendFunction.Min and BlendFunction.Max does not work.
When you try to use them, it launches an exception:
An unhandled exception of type 'System.NotImplementedException' occurred in MonoGame.Framework.dll

Additional information: Method or operation not implemented.

data.title: MonoGame Content Builder Fixes
data.body:
A few random fixes for some issues i found tonight:
- Fixed cases where "dot notation" was left in file paths (C:\paths\like....\this\should\not.exist)
- The project, output, and intermediate directory paths now always have a single trailing separator.
- Fixed crash within SongProcessor if the output path for the song did not exist.
- Fixed SongContentWriter to write duration with type information.

data.title: MGCB Building but not creating files
data.body:
I built MGCB for MacOSX and then when I try and use the command line tool I try to compile content and it tells me that the build was successful but there is no output. This is what I pass in 

```
mono MGCB.MacOS.exe /outputdir:/Users/maxmarze/Projects/MonoGame/Tools/MGCB/bin/Release/content/bin /intermediatedir:/Users/maxmarze/Projects/MonoGame/Tools/MGCB/bin/Release/content/obj /rebuild /importer:TextureImporter /processor:TextureProcessor /build:/Users/maxmarze/Projects/MGMTest/MGMTest/Content/earth.png /build:/Users/maxmarze/Projects/MGMTest/MGMTest/Content/shuttle.png /build:/Users/maxmarze/Projects/MGMTest/MGMTest/Content/stars.jpg
```

and the output is 

```
Build started 8/8/2013 12:37:22 PM


Build 3 succeeded, 0 failed.
```

Yet nothing is outputted to the directory I set. Is there an error in what I did? Also is it possible to build the content through xamarin yet?

data.title: Model compiler does not build shaders with MonoGame Processor & wrong MGFX version?
data.body:
I have a model which has an in built reference to a shader.
I have the shader in my content project and it compiles file using the MonoGame Processor 

However, the associated shader xnb is compiled using the XNA effect processor and not the monogame processor.

So I tried copying the shader asset that was compiled with MonoGame effect and replaced the one suffixed with _0 which is read as an MGFX shader.

But now it's reporting its the wrong MGFX version??

data.title: Error loading Model - reports incorrect name for associated shader
data.body:
When importing a model that has an associated shader, it fails to load due to a content error.

What is weird is that the exception it gives quotes the wrong name for the shader which is included and compiling in the content project.  The exception is:

"Could not load Content/shaders/ReflectionSimpleGlass_0 asset as a non-content file!"

However the shader xnb I have loaded is called:

ReflectionSimpleGlass.xnb

Is there something I'm doing wrong?

The shader is compiled with the "MonoGame effect" processor

data.title: Issues building shaders set to "MonoGame Effect" processor
Enhanced Viewport struct.
data.body: This patch added comments to Viewport, added few new useful constructors,fix ToString method, improve performance of Project and Unproject methods by using fields instead properties.
